name: Hilton Dallas/Southlake Town Square

reviews.text: I was here on business. The hotel itself was nice. Nothing spectacular, but the staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was nice and clean. There was a fair amount of noise from the neighboring rooms. They weren't being loud, but the walls seemed very thin. The only reason I didn't give it five out of five was just that there was nothing outstanding about it. It was a very nice hotel, but nothing that stands out. The area its in was the best part. Lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Nice place, well located

reviews.text: My wife and I have stayed here 3 times now and we love it. Close to the Southlake shopping, easy to get to and a great hotel all around. Staff is friendly and always willing to help.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: I really don't like to submit negative or mediocre reviews. I always figure, what the heck, WE booked the room, WE chose it, EVERYBODY is entitled to an off day, 'nuff said. But the Hilton Dallas/Southlake Town Square was a big disappointment. When you drive up to a circular drive and a port cochere, and have your car registered and your bags picked up by the bellhop, you expect something more than 1) a south-facing window with the thermostat controls frozen so that you can't sleep because of the heat; 2) an almost gnarling front desk clerk who practically throws your keys your way when you check out the next morning; 3) an uncleaned concierge lounge upon your return from the East Coast 2 days later; and 4) your second room littered with bits of potato chips and the hallways un-vacuumed, either. The only thing good about the stay was that we got a chance to see a couple of our kids at the adjoing Copeland's restaurant, and that we found the 3 Swedish-version, English-subtitled Blu-Ray of Stieg Larsson's "Milennium" Trilogy. Otherwise, we won't be staying at THAT Hilton property again.
reviews.title: Very disappointed in Southlake

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay at the Southlake Town Square Hilton. The property is in a great location with restaurants and upscale shops within walking distance. Room was spacious and clean. We stayed on executive floor which incuded complimentary breakfast. Great business center with free internet access. Close to the NASCAR race we attended at Texas Motor Speedway. Have stayed at the Joule, Four Seasons, and Gaylord and would pass them all up to stay here! Very friendly service to top all this off!
reviews.title: Beautiful Property - Great Area - You Will Love It

reviews.text: I stayed here for three days for a work conference. The hotel is beautiful. The staff was very friendly and quick to open doors for you.
reviews.title: Great Property!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton at Southlake Town Center is easy to get to and is in the midst of all of the shops and restaurants that would could ask for. For us, it was a weekend escape to celebrate an anniversary of sorts and the Hilton provided a relaxing oasis on a Saturday night.
reviews.title: Nice Weekend Getaway

reviews.text: The room was well appointed and the bed was quite comfortable. From the Hilton, we were within walking distance of our restaurant choice. The weekend rate was appealing and the hotel staff were responsive to the one issue that came up. We plan to visit again in the near future.
reviews.title: Location is superb for shopping.

reviews.text: In the middle of Southlake, you can shop all day in this location. And great restaurants are very close. Easy access from freeway.
reviews.title: Great location, great getaway, dining and shopping destination

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the hotel. The hotel was very generous to give us a free upgrade for our anniversary celebration. The staff were excellent and the room was very clean and cozzy! We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Does not live up the Hilton name

reviews.text: Stayed with Southlake Hilton on December 31st 2011 and I will not choose to spend a night with the Southlake Hilton location again. They lack the finishing touches that make a hotel stay a treat away from home. (Forgot champagne in the room, Room was dirty ((wrapping paper from Christmas in couch)), Hotel staff presented to be understaffed and inexperienced, Copeland’s restaurant was like a sports bar without the drink specials). In my opinion and recommendation I would spend a few dollars more and stay at the Gaylord or the Sheraton just down the road.
reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!

reviews.text: The best place to stay in DFW. The Town Square is always vibrant and the service is always friendly and on point.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: This was my second stay at the Hilton Southlake. I stayed here for business for 3 nights, and added on another 2 nights when my husband joined me.
reviews.title: As good as I remember

reviews.text: We had a one-bedroom suite, which wasn't anything special. It was actually rather small and basic, especially the bathroom. The amenities are good, but the walls are too thin - we woke up to the couple next door arguing at 6 am. The way the lights worked also annoyed me. The table lamp next to the couch only worked if you also switched on the white, overhead light. Generally the room was pretty standard for Hilton.
reviews.title: Family Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So why did I like this hotel so much despite the rather pedestrian room? Great location - Southlake Town Square has good restaurants, great shops and a movie theater. Fast, free Wi-Fi - finally, a business hotel that gets how important that is. Fantastic staff - from housekeeping to valet, everyone working there was helpful and friendly. This can make all the difference.
reviews.title: What else could you ask for?

reviews.text: If Hilton ever gives the rooms a contemporary makeover with better lighting, I'll give this place 5 stars.
reviews.title: Great Getaway Spot

reviews.text: The hotel and surroundings are very comfortable. The front door service could be better but overall, this hotel is a good value and in a great location. We will return to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Southlake over the Christmas Holidays. We stayed 3 nights. The hotel is is a GREAT location. Shopping, Restaurants steps away. The hotel was very clean and new looking. The customer service was very good. Friendly staff. Our room overlooked the little shopping area with a balcony. We were giving 3 nights as a gift, so we were able to have Concierge level. The breakfast was good every morning (Christmas morning we ate at Copelands per managements request) Coffee and Drinks available throughout the day. I'm not sure if it was because of the Holidays but there wasn't afternoon/evening snacks every night. One night I did see Fried Cheese Sticks at 10 PM? I did hear a lot of people voicing their concerns on lack of food? So, my advice is to verify what they will have before booking and paying for this level. The room was a gift for us, so any added was a plus, however, if I would have paid for that level expecting evening snacks etc then I would have been disappointed. With that said. I would stay here again on any level not just Concierge. The noise was a bit of a factor also... hall noise and doors closing/opening, maid service. I will say this is with most hotels. Not sure why there isn't a hotel door made that isn't loud :) Overall, a great stay. Clean rooms (very important) friendly staff, oh and free valet.
reviews.title: Christmas Break

reviews.text: We were here for a wedding back in May. It was ridiculously hot that weekend but the hotel was comfortable and clean. The food in their restaurant was pretty good. The best aspect of this hotel is its location. It is central to the all the shopping in Southlake and there are good options for dining in the area.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Have stayed in his hotel once a year for the past five years, all I can say is incredible!
reviews.title: Always a great stay

reviews.text: Starting with the location it is right in Southlake town center and everything from dining, shopping and even a movie theater is literally at the from door. The hotel is immaculately maintained, from the lobby to the elevators to the room it is spotless! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area.
reviews.title: Shopping , Anyone?

aka: Hilton Dallas/Southlake Town Square Hotel Southlake
description: Located an equal distance from downtown Dallas and Fort Worth, TX, the Hilton Dallas/Southlake Town Square hotel offers style and sophistication, conveniently located in Southlake Town Square, which features over 100 dining, retail and entertainment options. Ideal for a Southlake, TX weekend getaway, family reunion or any memorable social event. Relax in one of the 248 spacious rooms or 40 magnificent suites. Watch a movie on the flat-screen TV or surf the web with complimentary WiFi internet access. Unwind with a workout in the 24-hour fitness center. The business center is also available 24 hours a day to help you keep up with work using complimentary printing and a range of other business services. Over 15,000 sq. ft. of flexible meeting and event space, an ideal venue for your Dallas conference, workshop, special event or Southlake wedding. Take advantage of our high-tech facilities, personal service, catering, and online event planning tools to host a productive and successful event.
